description: From Middle English mayde, maide, abbreviation of Middle English maiden from Old English mægden. Ultimately from Proto-West Germanic *magaþ, from Proto-Germanic *magaþs (“maid, virgin”).

entries.meaning: (dated or poetic) A girl or an unmarried young woman; maiden.
A female servant or cleaner (short for maidservant).
(archaic) A virgin, now female but originally one of either gender.
